contentrichtext.text: {{ref improve|date=February 2013}} '''Voronezhavia''' was an [[airline]] based in [[Voronezh]], [[Russia]]. Its flight operations had been taken over by Polet Airlines, Voronezhavia itself manages Voronezh Airport. ==Code data== *[[IATA]] Code: '''ZT''' *[[ICAO]] Code: '''VRN''' *Callsign: Voronezhavia ==Destinations== ===Domestic destinations=== *[[Anapa]] *[[Chelyabinsk]] *[[Yekaterinburg]] *[[Kazan]] *[[Moscow]] *[[Norilsk]] *[[Perm]] *[[Saint Petersburg]] *[[Samara, Russia|Samara]] *[[Sochi]] *[[Ufa]] *[[Voronezh]] ===International destinations=== *'''[[Turkey]]''' **[[Adana]] *'''[[Azerbaijan]]''' **[[Baku]] *'''[[Moldova]]''' **[[Chişinău]] *'''[[Ukraine]]''' **[[Dnipropetrovsk]] **[[Kiev]] *'''[[Belarus]]''' **[[Minsk]] *'''[[Armenia]]''' **[[Yerevan]] ==External links== *[http://www.voronezhavia.ru Official website] {{Airlines of Russia}} [[Category:Defunct airlines of Russia]] [[Category:Former Aeroflot divisions]] [[Category:Companies based in Voronezh]] {{Russia-airline-stub}}
